job_title: Culinary Host in West Palm Beach, FL
pros: MorseLife offers lots of benefits and support to their employees. They do plenty of events to celebrate/appreciate their workers. It's generally a good working environment with friendly co-workers.
cons: The culinary host position doesn't provide any challenges. It's a repetitive job and doesn't provide much growth, which may be the reason for the high turnover rate.

job_title: Manager of Patient Services in West Palm Beach, FL
pros:
Great mission and vision.
CEO is forward-thinking and values education.
Great team spirit- there are some great employees.
The organization is dedicated to quality patient care.
cons:
Low pay for direct care staff.
Technology is lacking, more innovation is needed.
More recruiters are needed.

job_title: Registered Nurse in West Palm Beach, FL

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant in West Palm Beach, FL
pros: Great place to work. Some coworkers are nice to work with. Clean environment to work. Management is kind of uptight.
cons: the workload is heavy with little help

job_title: Activities Memory Care in West Palm Beach, FL
pros: Working with the amazing residents! Enhancing their day to day lives.
cons: Working conditions not being warned about a new very violent resident. Having been violently assaulted from behind and thrown into a credenza and tv and then to the ground by a new resident without warning! I have major injuries and not one of my managers reached out to see how i was. This happened on a Saturday. No management in house. They just don’t care. After over 2 years of dedication no contact. Thank goodness he attacked me and not one of tge two frail residents that witnessed the attack. They were screaming and crying and yelling! Help her! Help her!it’s getting worse. Putting our residents in an unsafe environment is elder abuse. It’s all about profits- more heads in beds! It’s such a shame.

job_title: Culinary Director in West Palm Beach, FL
pros: Very supportive management team with goals of continual improvement and employee appreciation. Always working to strengthen team work and to satisfy the residents.
cons: Tough residents, lots of walking, and a lot of names to remember.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in West Palm Beach, FL
pros: The management team is stable and very interested in growing their team. They have positive attitudes and promote education and learning. The company is growing rapidly with lots of room to move up and make a change. The campus is also gorgeous.
cons: Morselife? It’s actually no life. The leadership team does not promote a work life balance. As part of the leadership team you are expected to work 24/7 and that includes weekends! If you need time off you get the 3rd degree which is frustrating. If you value your kids and Home life don’t take a job in leadership here you will never get to see them.

review_title: Top Place to Work in South Florida
job_title: Human Resources in West Palm Beach, FL
pros: MorseLife Health System truly cares about its employees. MorseLife has created an environment where you are rewarded for hard work and encourages career development through an in-house Learning Institute available to all employees! If you want to succeed, MorseLife is the place to come and express your inner greatness.
cons: MorseLife is growing like crazy. The tremendous growth is exciting but it keeps the pressure on to perform day in and day out. They do everything they can to help you be successful but it isn't always easy.

job_title: CNA in West Palm Beach, FL
pros: The residents are amazing. I worked in the Alzheimers unit and all of the residents were mobile. They are happy and otherwise healthy. It's like visiting your grandparents at their homes each time you step into their private rooms that are set up like apartments. I love that it's a home feel and not institutional. They even have a private chef and salon.
cons: The pay could be better.  Can get stressful if a patient falls or get hurt or fall ill.

review_title: Never thought I'd work at a nursing home.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in West Palm Beach, FL
pros: Very satisfying to be a part of a company that is dedicated to the well-being of their residents and rehab clients.  i was always proud to tell others who I worked for.
cons: Occasionally, management fails to recognize that the overall success of the organization depends on the caring staff.

job_title: Housekeeper in West Palm Beach, FL
pros: Lots of opportunities for growth.  HR department is very friendly and have lots of social events.  Salaries are consistent if not higher than the industry standard.
cons: Would like to see more communication with employees, especially those in housekeeping and other support staff departments.

review_title: It is good for a part time position but nothing long term available
